TopicTitle: Where is the Oblique Impact Site on Gilly?

Articles.Content:
Tried googling it and searching here on the forum but no answer. 
Found it first time I played but can not find it now and overflown the largest craters but no success, does anybody know?
I remember doing this mission. You should have a ground target from what I recall to show you exactly where to land. Nothing on the map view?

4 hours ago, Biggen said:

I remember doing this mission. You should have a ground target from what I recall to show you exactly where to land. Nothing on the map view?

This i before the mission. I have an Bill on Gilly and want to get science from biome before the return window closes.

Last time i had no problem finding it before mission, might be polar?

4 hours ago, magnemoe said:

This i before the mission. I have an Bill on Gilly and want to get science from biome before the return window closes.

Last time i had no problem finding it before mission, might be polar?

I don’t think it was polar. I remember it being a fairly good size crater though.
I found it, very obvious and no idea how I missed it, around 90 degree east of the two discoverables on the northern hemisphere

I added it to the wiki a month ago, but was waiting a while before pasting my region map from orbital survey there and then I forgot.

https://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Gilly#KSP2_Surface_Research_Locations

Edited February 19 by rogerawong
